intro: Ornithogalum ovatum, commonly known as the star-of-Bethlehem, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It features a basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and produces striking, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The plant belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its bulbous root system. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Ornithogalum ovatum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
